required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Changes in Bioimpedance During Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Changes in Bioimpedance During Cardia Resynchronization Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims at Optimizing measured parameters to reflect underlying pathology in dyssynchronous hearts. This is an experimental study in patients were bioimpedance measurements are performed during implantation.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who are eligible for implantation af a Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy Device according to European Society of Cardiology guidelines are included. Measurements are performed on implanted leads and stored for post Processing. The study entry ends for each patient With completion of the implantation procedure.

primary_outcome.description: Acquisition of absolute and imaginary bioimpedance signals from electrodes of known location within the heart at different input current frequencies. Pacing is performed from Three different electrodes during acquisition of bioimpedance acquisition forming Three different groups. Wavelets of the signals are analyzed within each Group and compared within the Group and between the Groups. Optimization is achived when a discrimination factor that is calculated is improved.

arm_group.description: This single arm study is designed to measure impedance signals from implanted leads in different positions in the heart. Signals obtained at different pre specified position are compared to each other to determine the robustness of the acquired measurements.

intervention.intervention_name: Impedance measurements in Cardiac Resynchronization therapy

criteria.textblock: - Indication for Cardiac resynchronization therapy or Upgrade of exciting Device according to the current European Society of Cardiology guidelines.
